strings.Value: "Tartuk, it's time to help me like I once helped you. Will you and your kobolds help us protect my kingdom?"
"Once, long ago, we fought side by side against assassins... Would you join me to fight once more?"
"Trobold is cleansed. I have to keep going."
{n}Tartuk stands from his crouched position as he sees you approach. He looks to have taken a beating, but none of his wounds seem to be serious.{/n} "{name}? Did you come... for me?"
"My friendsss will help you protect your home. Asss soon as we're shhhure the dungeon isss safe, I will sssend them to help your cccity. Good luck to usss, {name}."
"I have to go — my sssubjects await me. Good luck to usss, {name}!"

{n}Tartuk sways silently for a moment before finally clutching his head with a hiss.{/n} "I remember... but I don't... I usssed to be someone else... But thisss door, it isss locked. I ssscratch and ssscream, hit and bite, but still it isss locked."

{n}The kobold hisses wildly.{/n} "Ssstop tormenting me with your questionsss! I am Tartuk! King of Kobolds! Protector of our kingdom! Tartuk, and no one elssse! And asss for your requessst..." {n}The shaman stretches his clawed fingers out, weaving a spell.{/n} "I sssat on my handsss for too long. I will go with you, {name}. I will rip the throat from thossse who did thisss to my kingdom."
{n}Tartuk lowers his head, and the horse skull he wears shifts down a bit.{/n} "You gave me a chanccce. Me and the ressst of koboldsss. We will repay you. We will help you protect your kingdom."

{n}Tartuk makes a strange sound — after a moment, you recognize it as the kobold version of a disdainful scoff.{/n} "Dumb troll. Ssswung hisss paw, threw me againssst the wall. I am tougher than I ssseem." {n}The kobold probes his ribs carefully.{/n}
"They hid when trollsss started trassshing everything! Fear not, {name}, I sssay one word, and they will come out of their cracksss."

"I know magic, but thisss... thisss is unfamiliar to me. Asss if a shhhell burssst, and sssomething came rushhhing into thisss world — into {g|Trobold}Trobold{/g}. Hargulka returned to life. Ssstarted demanding the kingdom to himssself. I had to pretend I wasss dead... and wait."
